Module com.example.breakout_clone
Package com.example.breakout_clone.model.sprite

Class BallModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.breakout_clone.model.sprite.SpriteModel
com.example.breakout_clone.model.sprite.BallModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Impactable, Movable
public class BallModel extends SpriteModel implements Movable, Impactable
Model class for the Ball MVC. The class implements the Movable and the Impactable interfaces. This class contains the main sprite logic for how to move the ball and what happens when the ball collides with the something
Author:
Praket Chavan
See Also:
SpriteModel

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed​(javafx.geometry.Point2D speed)
      Set the speed of the sprite to the new speed The new speed is normalized and then multiplied by 4 to ensure that the ball speed is consistent even if the X and Y speed have changed
      Overrides:
      setSpeed in class SpriteModel
      Parameters:
      speed - the new speed of the ball
      See Also:
      SpriteModel.getSpeed()

      See Also:
      updateLocations()

    • findImpact

      public int findImpact​(Impactable parent)
      Find the impact between the current object and the passed impactable object

      The method finds the impact of the ball with the game wall

      Specified by:
      findImpact in interface Impactable
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent in this case will null
      Returns:
      a constant value signifying the direction of the collision
      See Also:
      Impactable.GAME_BOUNDS

    • onImpact

      public void onImpact​(int side)
      function to carry out steps once a collision has been detected

      This method is handle the action that the ball takes depending on which direction the ball has collided from

      Specified by:
      onImpact in interface Impactable
      Parameters:
      side - the direction of the collision
